availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James R. Montgomery (Louisville, Kentucky, druggist and resident)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, druggist and resident. Kentucky native. Married to Maria McKay Montgomery in Nelson County, Kentucky, on February 3, 1825. Father of Stephen W. Montgomery, Samuel Montgomery, Martha Montgomery, James Montgomery, and Emily Montgomery. Druggist in Louisville, Jefferson County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned eight enslaved persons in Louisville in 1850. Resident of Louisville in 1860. Owned eight enslaved persons in Louisville in 1860. Notary public in Jefferson County.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, Ward 7, p. 353A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, Ward 7, p. 869.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 4, p. 73.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Nelson County Marriages, Film 001929414, p. 146.
KYR-0001-017-0279.
